00046 Symbol::Symbol(const std::string &n, SourcePos p, const Type *t) 
00047   : pos(p), name(n) {
00048     storagePtr = NULL;
00049     function = NULL;
00050     type = t;
00051     constValue = NULL;
00052     isStatic = false;
00053     varyingCFDepth = 0;
00054 }

00056 
00057 std::string
00058 Symbol::MangledName() const {
00059     return name + type->Mangle();
00060 }

00065 
00066 SymbolTable::SymbolTable() {
00067     PushScope();
00068 }
00069 
00070 
00071 SymbolTable::~SymbolTable() {
00072     // Otherwise we have mismatched push/pop scopes
00073     assert(variables.size() == 1 && types.size() == 1);
00074     PopScope();
00075 }
00076 
00077 void
00078 SymbolTable::PushScope() { 
00079     variables.push_back(new std::vector<Symbol *>); 
00080     types.push_back(new TypeMapType);
00081 }
00082 
00083 
00084 void
00085 SymbolTable::PopScope() { 
00086     // FIXME: delete Symbols in variables vector<>...
00087     assert(variables.size() > 1);
00088     delete variables.back();
00089     variables.pop_back();
00090     assert(types.size() > 1);
00091     delete types.back();
00092     types.pop_back();
00093 }

00095 
00096 bool
00097 SymbolTable::AddVariable(Symbol *symbol) {
00098     assert(symbol != NULL);
00099 
00100     // Check to see if a symbol of the same name has already been declared.
00101     for (int i = (int)variables.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
00102         std::vector<Symbol *> &sv = *(variables[i]);
00103         for (int j = (int)sv.size() - 1; j >= 0; --j) {
00104             if (sv[j]->name == symbol->name) {
00105                 if (i == (int)variables.size()-1) {
00106                     // If a symbol of the same name was declared in the
00107                     // same scope, it's an error.
00108                     Error(symbol->pos, "Ignoring redeclaration of symbol \"%s\".", 
00109                           symbol->name.c_str());
00110                     return false;
00111                 }
00112                 else {
00113                     // Otherwise it's just shadowing something else, which
00114                     // is legal but dangerous..
00115                     Warning(symbol->pos, 
00116                             "Symbol \"%s\" shadows symbol declared in outer scope.",
00117                             symbol->name.c_str());
00118                     variables.back()->push_back(symbol);
00119                     return true;
00120                 }
00121             }
00122         }
00123     }
00124 
00125     // No matches, so go ahead and add it...
00126     variables.back()->push_back(symbol);
00127     return true;
00128 }
00129 
00130 
00131 Symbol *
00132 SymbolTable::LookupVariable(const char *name) {
00133     // Note that we iterate through the variables vectors backwards, sinec
00134     // we want to search from the innermost scope to the outermost, so that
00135     // we get the right symbol if we have multiple variables in different
00136     // scopes that shadow each other.
00137     std::vector<std::vector<Symbol *> *>::reverse_iterator liter = variables.rbegin();
00138     while (liter != variables.rend()) {
00139         std::vector<Symbol *> &sv = *(*liter);
00140         for (int i = (int)sv.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i)
00141             if (sv[i]->name == name) 
00142                 return sv[i];
00143         ++liter;
00144     }
00145     return NULL;
00146 }
00147 
00148 
00149 bool
00150 SymbolTable::AddFunction(Symbol *symbol) {
00151     const FunctionType *ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(symbol->type);
00152     assert(ft != NULL);
00153     if (LookupFunction(symbol->name.c_str(), ft) != NULL)
00154         // A function of the same name and type has already been added to
00155         // the symbol table
00156         return false;
00157 
00158     functions[symbol->name].push_back(symbol);
00159     return true;
00160 }
00161 
00162 
00163 std::vector<Symbol *> *
00164 SymbolTable::LookupFunction(const char *name) {
00165     if (functions.find(name) != functions.end())
00166         return &functions[name];
00167     return NULL;
00168 }
00169 
00170 
00171 Symbol *
00172 SymbolTable::LookupFunction(const char *name, const FunctionType *type) {
00173     if (functions.find(name) == functions.end())
00174         return NULL;
00175 
00176     std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs = functions[name];
00177     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i)
00178         if (Type::Equal(funcs[i]->type, type))
00179             return funcs[i];
00180     return NULL;
00181 }
00182 
00183 
00184 bool
00185 SymbolTable::AddType(const char *name, const Type *type, SourcePos pos) {
00186     // Like AddVariable(), we go backwards through the type maps, working
00187     // from innermost scope to outermost.
00188     for (int i = types.size()-1; i >= 0; --i) {
00189         TypeMapType &sm = *(types[i]);
00190         if (sm.find(name) != sm.end()) {
00191             if (i == (int)types.size() - 1) {
00192                 Error(pos, "Ignoring redefinition of type \"%s\".", name);
00193                 return false;
00194             }
00195             else {
00196                 Warning(pos, "Type \"%s\" shadows type declared in outer scope.", name);
00197                 TypeMapType &sm = *(types.back());
00198                 sm[name] = type;
00199                 return true;
00200             }
00201         }
00202     }
00203 
00204     TypeMapType &sm = *(types.back());
00205     sm[name] = type;
00206     return true;
00207 }
00208 
00209 
00210 const Type *
00211 SymbolTable::LookupType(const char *name) const {
00212     // Again, search through the type maps backward to get scoping right.
00213     for (int i = types.size()-1; i >= 0; --i) {
00214         TypeMapType &sm = *(types[i]);
00215         if (sm.find(name) != sm.end())
00216             return sm[name];
00217     }
00218     return NULL;
00219 }

00221 
00222 std::vector<std::string>
00223 SymbolTable::ClosestVariableOrFunctionMatch(const char *str) const {
00224     // This is a little wasteful, but we'll look through all of the
00225     // variable and function symbols and compute the edit distance from the
00226     // given string to them.  If the edit distance is under maxDelta, then
00227     // it goes in the entry of the matches[] array corresponding to its
00228     // edit distance.
00229     const int maxDelta = 2;
00230     std::vector<std::string> matches[maxDelta+1];
00231 
00232     for (int i = 0; i < (int)variables.size(); ++i) {
00233         std::vector<Symbol *> &sv = *(variables[i]);
00234         for (int j = 0; j < (int)sv.size(); ++j) {
00235             int dist = StringEditDistance(str, sv[j]->name, maxDelta+1);
00236             if (dist <= maxDelta)
00237                 matches[dist].push_back(sv[j]->name);
00238         }
00239     }
00240 
00241     std::map<std::string, std::vector<Symbol *> >::const_iterator iter;
00242     for (iter = functions.begin(); iter != functions.end(); ++iter) {
00243         int dist = StringEditDistance(str, iter->first, maxDelta+1);
00244             if (dist <= maxDelta)
00245                 matches[dist].push_back(iter->first);
00246     }
00247 
00248     // Now, return the first entry of matches[] that is non-empty, if any.
00249     for (int i = 0; i <= maxDelta; ++i) {
00250         if (matches[i].size())
00251             return matches[i];
00252     }
00253 
00254     // Otherwise, no joy.
00255     return std::vector<std::string>();
00256 }

00259 std::vector<std::string>
00260 SymbolTable::ClosestTypeMatch(const char *str) const {
00261     return closestTypeMatch(str, true);
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 std::vector<std::string>
00266 SymbolTable::ClosestEnumTypeMatch(const char *str) const {
00267     return closestTypeMatch(str, false);
00268 }
00269 
00270 
00271 std::vector<std::string>
00272 SymbolTable::closestTypeMatch(const char *str, bool structsVsEnums) const {
00273     // This follows the same approach as ClosestVariableOrFunctionMatch()
00274     // above; compute all edit distances, keep the ones shorter than
00275     // maxDelta, return the first non-empty vector of one or more sets of
00276     // alternatives with minimal edit distance.
00277     const int maxDelta = 2;
00278     std::vector<std::string> matches[maxDelta+1];
00279 
00280     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < types.size(); ++i) {
00281         TypeMapType::const_iterator iter;
00282         for (iter = types[i]->begin(); iter != types[i]->end(); ++iter) {
00283             // Skip over either StructTypes or EnumTypes, depending on the
00284             // value of the structsVsEnums parameter
00285             bool isEnum = (dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(iter->second) != NULL);
00286             if (isEnum && structsVsEnums)
00287                 continue;
00288             else if (!isEnum && !structsVsEnums)
00289                 continue;
00290 
00291             int dist = StringEditDistance(str, iter->first, maxDelta+1);
00292             if (dist <= maxDelta)
00293                 matches[dist].push_back(iter->first);
00294         }
00295     }
00296 
00297     for (int i = 0; i <= maxDelta; ++i) {
00298         if (matches[i].size())
00299             return matches[i];
00300     }
00301     return std::vector<std::string>();
00302 }

00304 
00305 void
00306 SymbolTable::Print() {
00307     int depth = 0;
00308     fprintf(stderr, "Variables:\n----------------\n");
00309     std::vector<std::vector<Symbol *> *>::iterator liter = variables.begin();
00310     while (liter != variables.end()) {
00311         fprintf(stderr, "%*c", depth, ' ');
00312         std::vector<Symbol *>::iterator siter = (*liter)->begin();
00313         while (siter != (*liter)->end()) {
00314             fprintf(stderr, "%s [%s]", (*siter)->name.c_str(), 
00315                     (*siter)->type->GetString().c_str());
00316             ++siter;
00317         }
00318         ++liter;
00319         fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00320         depth += 4;
00321     }
00322 
00323     fprintf(stderr, "Functions:\n----------------\n");
00324     std::map<std::string, std::vector<Symbol *> >::iterator fiter;
00325     fiter = functions.begin();
00326     while (fiter != functions.end()) {
00327         fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", fiter->first.c_str());
00328         std::vector<Symbol *> &syms = fiter->second;
00329         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < syms.size(); ++i)
00330             fprintf(stderr, "    %s\n", syms[i]->type->GetString().c_str());
00331         ++fiter;
00332     }
00333 
00334     depth = 0;
00335     fprintf(stderr, "Named types:\n---------------\n");
00336     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < types.size(); ++i) {
00337         TypeMapType &sm = *types[i];
00338         TypeMapType::iterator siter = sm.begin();
00339         while (siter != sm.end()) {
00340             fprintf(stderr, "%*c", depth, ' ');
00341             fprintf(stderr, "%s -> %s\n", siter->first.c_str(),
00342                     siter->second->GetString().c_str());
00343             ++siter;
00344         }
00345         depth += 4;
00346     }
00347 }
